publishers
Class MessagePublisher

java.lang.Object
  publishers.MessagePublisher

public final class MessagePublisher
extends java.lang.Object

This class consists of methods that allow a User to subscribe or unsubscibe to get a message when an order for a specified stock is cancelled, when an order for a specified stock is filled, and a message providing the market state for a specified stock.

Author:
Urvi

Method Summary
static MessagePublisher getInstance()
          Returns the only instance of the MessagePublisher that will be used throughout the system.
 void publishCancel(CancelMessage cm)
          Sends out cancel messages for a specified stock to users.
 void publishFill(FillMessage fm)
          Sends out fill messages for a specified stock to users.
 void publishMarketMessage(MarketMessage mm)
          Sends out market messages for a specified stock to users.
 void subscribe(User user, java.lang.String prod)
          Subscribes a user to receive message updates for a given stock.
 void unSubscribe(User user, java.lang.String prod)
          Unsubscribes a user from receiving message updates for a given stock.

public static MessagePublisher getInstance()
                                    throws InvalidArgumentException
Returns the only instance of the MessagePublisher that will be used throughout the system.

Returns:

Throws:

See Also:
MessagePublisherImplFactory.getPublisher(publishers.IPublisher.PubType)

subscribe

public void subscribe(User user,
                      java.lang.String prod)
               throws AlreadySubscribedException,
                      InvalidArgumentException
Subscribes a user to receive message updates for a given stock.

Parameters:
user - User who wishes to subscribe.
prod - Product symbol for which User wants cancel, fill, or market messages.
Throws:
AlreadySubscribedException - if user is already subscribed to the product.
InvalidArgumentException - if user or prod is null

unSubscribe

public void unSubscribe(User user,
                        java.lang.String prod)
                 throws NotSubscribedException,
                        InvalidArgumentException
Unsubscribes a user from receiving message updates for a given stock.

Parameters:
user - User who wishes to unsubscribe.
prod - Product symbol for which User no longer wants cancel, fill, or market messages.
Throws:
NotSubscribedException - if user was not subscribed to the product.
InvalidArgumentException - if user or prod is null

publishCancel

public void publishCancel(CancelMessage cm)
                   throws InvalidArgumentException
Sends out cancel messages for a specified stock to users.

Parameters:
cm - The cancel message to send to users.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if cm is null

publishFill

public void publishFill(FillMessage fm)
                 throws InvalidArgumentException
Sends out fill messages for a specified stock to users.

Parameters:
fm - The fill message to send to users.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if fm is null

publishMarketMessage

public void publishMarketMessage(MarketMessage mm)
                          throws InvalidArgumentException
Sends out market messages for a specified stock to users.

Parameters:
mm - The market message to send to users.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if mm is null
